channel.title: That same ugly mustache..can't change it!
channel.description:
Egh...This really sucks. On my server, you can only have a mustache. It doesnt matter if you use the ::char command and change to a beard or nothing at all, you're still stuck with that same mustache. (Same color too) PLEASE DO NOT TELL ME TO GET A DIFFERENT SOURCE! PLEASE DO NOT FLAME!
Thanks in advance.

item.title: That same ugly mustache..can't change it!
item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

Java, I did. And I already have all those things in your tut in my client! I’ll try replacing the case 101 already in the server with the one you gave me. Shrugs

Ok, didn’t work. This is really pissing me off.

Read full topic

item.title: That same ugly mustache..can't change it!
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

I have a tut to fix it, not made by me, the letters might come up a bit small. Here: (BTW comes like that, WORST indentation i’ve ever seen.

Purpose: To fix the ::char command so it changes your appearance

Difficulty: 2

Assumed Knowledge: you should know how to add voids

Server Base: cheeazscape 78

Classes Modified: client.java

ok for you people who have testscape and the ::char command doesnt work then i have fixed your problem .
found the code needed in cheez 78 anyway here what 2 do

Procedure
Step 1

look for
Code:

case 72: //Click to attack

after that case add these 2 cases

/*case 101: // dunno wtf this is lol, *looks at char design tut* OF COURSE! :P                                int boolean1047 = inStream.readUnsignedWord(); // apset? wtf is that lol                                int unknown = inStream.readUnsignedWord(); 	                                System.out.println("Packet 101: Boolean1047 = "+boolean1047);                                 System.out.println("Packet 101: Unknown = "+unknown);                                 break;*/			  case 101: //Character Design Screen                                int gender = inStream.readSignedByte();                                int head = inStream.readSignedByte();                                int jaw = inStream.readSignedByte();                                int torso = inStream.readSignedByte();                                int arms = inStream.readSignedByte();                                int hands = inStream.readSignedByte();                                int legs = inStream.readSignedByte();                                int feet = inStream.readSignedByte();                                int hairC = inStream.readSignedByte();                                int torsoC = inStream.readSignedByte();                                int legsC = inStream.readSignedByte();                                int feetC = inStream.readSignedByte();                                int skinC = inStream.readSignedByte();                                playerLook[0] = gender;                                pHead = head;                                pBeard = jaw;                                pTorso = torso;                                pArms = arms;                                pHands = hands;                                pLegs = legs;                                pFeet = feet;                                playerLook[1] = hairC;                                playerLook[2] = torsoC;                                playerLook[3] = legsC;                                playerLook[4] = feetC;                                playerLook[5] = skinC;                                appearanceUpdateRequired = true;                                break;

step 2

now find case 185: and add

case 14067: // Char design accept button RemoveAllWindows(); break;

and now ure done

and incase u dont have it heres the ::char command add it with the rest of ure commands

Code:

else if(command.startsWith("char")) { showInterface(3559); }

Read full topic

item.title: That same ugly mustache..can't change it!
item.dc:creator: @A_L_I_V_E A L I V E
item.description:
@A_L_I_V_E wrote:

This is what i did,I downloaded a diff. server source where the code actually worked.I used it as a “backup” file incase if my present server files didn’t work.I could just copy+paste from the “backup” server and paste it onto my present server.It worked for me!

You should try it out!

item.title: That same ugly mustache..can't change it!
item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

I already have that code though…

Update: Except it has headIcon = newheadicon; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; directly after it, does that make a difference? It’s supposed to be there right…

Another update: Yup…looked in my old source files, and it says the exact same code. So it’s not in there…

item.description:
@A_L_I_V_E wrote:

} else if(command.startsWith("char") && playerRights <= 441) { showInterface(3559); } else if(command.startsWith("newhead")) { int newheadicon = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(8));

Try that,if i made a mistake,please correct me!
